The key of the SECURITY.POSITION file is made up of seven elements separated by dots. These elements are; Portfolio Number Security Number Depository Nominee Code Maturity Date Interest Rate and Sub-Account.

Note ; The Maturity Date and Interest Rate are only included in the key of the Security Position if the Security the position is for is flagged as a KassenObligationen on the Sub Asset Type record the Security is linked to.
These fields make up the first seven fields of the SECURITY.POSITION record.

The Portfolio Number is the portfolio whose position this is if this is a portfolio position or it is the Depository Number with a suffix of '-999' if it is a depository position. The Security Number is the Security Master ID of the Security. The Depository is the Depository where the position is held. The Nominee Code is blank if this position is not held by nominee and contains the ID from the NOMINEE.CODE file if this position is held by Nominee. The Sub Account is the depository sub account where the position is held.
The nominal of securities relating to this security position that remains unreceived.
No input, System generated field

This field will hold the undelivered nominal due from the Broker raised from REPO transaction. The fields RP.BROKER.NO and RP.UNSETT.NOM is a associated multi value set. The value in this field will be reduced to the extent the position is settled for that broker.
No Input. System Generated field.

This field is only updated is this security position is for a Kassenobligationen security. A Kassenobligationen security is one where the Sub Asset Type record linked to the security has the KASSENOBLIGATIONEN flag set to YES.

If the security identified in the SECURITY.NUMBER field is a Kassenobligationen security then this will be the maturity date for the security - taken from the MATURITY.DATE field on the Security Master record - at the time the SECURITY.POSITION record was created.
The Maturity Date (if any) in this field will make-up the fifth (of six) elements tat make-up the ID of the SECURITY.POSITION record.

Note; this field will contain the latest date for a trade date that updated this SECURITY.POSITION record. Thus if the record has been updated by two transactions; One with a trade date of 30th May 1996 and the other 5th June 1996 then this field will contain 05/06/1996 even if the transaction with this trade date had been entered into the system before the transaction with the trade date of 30/05/1996.

If part - or all - of the security position is blocked then this portion of the position will not be included when calculating orders. Also the system will prevent the user form selling the blocked position.

This field holds a sum value of the unsettled nominal amount. During a free transfer (SECURITY.TRANSFER), the nominal being traded is not settled and is not part of the customer portfolio valuation. It is therefore stored on this field, and every time an amount is settled, the value on this field is reduced by the settled amount until all the nominal is settled.

The value dated position is contained in the VALUE.DATED.POSN field and is updated overnight during the Batch processing.

Either the portfolio the Security Position is for or the depot the security position is for. Format is 6N - 3N Where 6N is the customer number and 3N the suffix. If the suffix is 999 then the security position is for the depository whose ID is the 6N prefix of this field, if the suffix is 777 then then security position is for the boker whose ID is the 6N prefix, otherwise (suffix is not 999 or 777) then this is the ID of the portfolio the security position is for.

The number of securities related to this Security Position record that are the subject of open SEC.OPEN.ORDER records. If a SEC.OPEN.ORDER is created then this field will be updated with the number of securities on the order that relate to this security position. When the SEC.OPEN.ORDER is executed then the number of securities concerned are removed from this figure. This figure is used when calculating subsequent orders from ORDER.BY.CUST or the Portfolio Modelling suite of programs to prevent duplicate orders being created. This field is always updated by orders that debit the position. Setting the UPD.OUTST.ORD.CRED field on SC.STD.SEC.TRADE to YES will result in this field being updated by orders tht credit the position also.
